channel.description: Curated daily news for 3D printing enthusiasts.

item.title: 3D PRINTING PULSE #41 - 2026-02-17
item.description:
ü¶∫ MIT Introduces MagMix to Reduce Cell Settling in 3D Bioprinting, Addresses Key Limitation Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have created MagMix, a compact magnetic system that actively prevents cell settling during 3D bioprinting, producing more uniform and functional tissues. The innovation addresses a key limitation in biofabrication: sedimentation in bioinks‚Äîa mixture of living cells and hydrogels‚Äîwhich can cause clogging, uneven cell distribution, and inconsistent tissue [‚Ä¶], reported by 3D Printing Industry on Feb 16, 2026. Image ? https://3dprintingindustry.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/SK-01C-150x100.jpg Read more ? https://3dprintingindustry.com/news/mit-introduces-magmix-to-reduce-cell-settling-in-3d-bioprinting-addresses-key-limitation-248983

Backed with around ‚Ç¨1.5 million through the BMFTR‚Äôs VIP+ validation [‚Ä¶], reported by 3D Printing Industry on Feb 16, 2026. Image ? https://3dprintingindustry.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/bild-3-pm-InnoWaerm-150x100.jpg Read more ? https://3dprintingindustry.com/news/germany-funds-titanium-aluminide-additive-reactors-to-advance-hydrogen-mobility-248970

These additions aim to give customers seamless support across the entire product development lifecycle, from a single prototype to large-scale production, reported by 3D Printing Industry on Feb 16, 2026.
